byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Falih Hassan and Ahmed Saleh contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Iraqi military and allied Shiite militias begin offensive to retake city of Tikrit from Islamic State; Prime Min Haider al-Abadi says residents of city must take sides and offers amnesty to those who were forced to join Islamic State if they assist security forces.
lead_paragraph: The effort to take back Saddam Hussein’s hometown could deepen the sectarian divide or become a pivotal fight in the campaign to reclaim the north and west of the country.

headline.main: Iraqi Offensive to Retake Tikrit From ISIS Begins
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Offensive to Retake Tikrit From ISIS Begins

snippet: The effort to take back Saddam Hussein’s hometown could deepen the sectarian divide or become a pivotal fight in the campaign to reclaim the north and west of the country.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
